bibl.title: Report: Monthly Sanitary Report, by Ira C. Brown, March 31, 1899

div1.p: This report lists camp conditions and the buildings that have been completed for the military hospital in Havana, Cuba.

div1.head: Report: Monthly Sanitary Report, by Ira C. Brown, March 31, 1899
div1.p:
Station, 2nd Division Hospital 7th A. C.
Camp Columbia Havana Cuba

SIR: In compliance with the provisions of paragraph 1393, Army Regulations, 1895, I have the honor
to make the following report for the month ending March 31, 1899:

Drainage, sewerage, and disposal of wastes: Drainage excellent - natural from
grounds; Disposal of wastes. Coated to dump ground
3 miles distant
Water supply: Excellent - by pipe line.
Food supply and its preparation: Excellent

Noted in the Medical History of Post, and respectfully forwarded to the Commanding Officer, with the
following recommendations: That Sewer system be completed - Plans
now completed for flush sinks forwards.

(Date.) Mch 31, 1899
Camp Columbia, Havana, Cuba,
2nd Division Hospital, 7th A.C.

Ira C. Brown
Major and Brigade Surgeon U.S.V.
Commanding Hospital Surgeon.
